title: Time-space-frequency feature Fusion for 3-channel motor imagery classification. (arXiv:2304.01461v1 [cs.LG])
abstract: Low-channel EEG devices are crucial for portable and entertainment applications. However, the low spatial resolution of EEG presents challenges in decoding low-channel motor imagery. This study introduces TSFF-Net, a novel network architecture that integrates time-space-frequency features, effectively compensating for the limitations of single-mode feature extraction networks based on time-series or time-frequency modalities. TSFF-Net comprises four main components: time-frequency representation, time-frequency feature extraction, time-space feature extraction, and feature fusion and classification. Time-frequency representation and feature extraction transform raw EEG signals into time-frequency spectrograms and extract relevant features. The time-space network processes time-series EEG trials as input and extracts temporal-spatial features. Feature fusion employs MMD loss to constrain the distribution of time-frequency and time-space features in the Reproducing Kernel Hilbert Space,

Title: Time-space-frequency feature Fusion for 3-channel motor imagery classification. (arXiv:2304.01461v1 [cs.LG])
Abstract: Low-channel EEG devices are crucial for portable and entertainment applications. However, the low spatial resolution of EEG presents challenges in decoding low-channel motor imagery. This study introduces TSFF-Net, a novel network architecture that integrates time-space-frequency features, effectively compensating for the limitations of single-mode feature extraction networks based on time-series or time-frequency modalities. TSFF-Net comprises four main components: time-frequency representation, time-frequency feature extraction, time-space feature extraction, and feature fusion and classification. Time-frequency representation and feature extraction transform raw EEG signals into time-frequency spectrograms and extract relevant features. The time-space network processes time-series EEG trials as input and extracts temporal-spatial features. Feature fusion employs MMD loss to constrain the distribution of time-frequency and time-space features in the Reproducing Kernel Hilbert Space,
translated_title: 时间-空间-频率特征融合的3通道运动想象分类
translated_abstract: 低通道EEG设备对于便携和娱乐应用至关重要，然而EEG低空间分辨率存在挑战，难以解码低通道运动想象。本研究引入TSFF-Net，一种新颖的网络架构，将时间-空间-频率特征融合，在时间序列或时间-频率模态下的单模特征提取网络的限制下发挥作用。TSFF-Net包括四个主要组件：时间-频率表示、时间-频率特征提取、时间-空间特征提取和特征融合与分类。时间-频率表示和特征提取将原始EEG信号转换为时间-频率谱图并提取相关特征。时空网络将时间序列EEG试验作为输入处理，并提取时间-空间特征。特征融合采用MMD损失在再生核希尔伯特空间中约束时间-频率和时间-空间特征的分布。
tldr: 本文提出了一种新网络架构TSFF-Net，将时间-空间-频率特征融合，解决了单模特征提取网络在时间序列或时间-频率模态下的限制。TSFF-Net包括时间-频率表示、时间-频率特征提取、时间-空间特征提取和特征融合与分类四个主要组件。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a new network architecture called TSFF-Net that integrates time-space-frequency features to compensate for the limitations of single-mode feature extraction networks based on time-series or time-frequency modalities. TSFF-Net includes four main components: time-frequency representation, time-frequency feature extraction, time-space feature extraction, and feature fusion and classification.
